VARIABLE_ALREADY_EXISTS_FOR_ANOTHER_TYPE: A variable named '%1' already exists for another type: '%2'.
CANNOT_DELETE_VARIABLE_PROCEDURE: Can't delete the variable '%1' because it's part of the definition of the function '%2'
COLOUR_PICKER_TOOLTIP: Choose a colour from the palette.
COLOUR_RGB_TOOLTIP: Create a colour with the specified amount of red, green, and blue. All values must be between 0 and 100.
COLOUR_BLEND_TOOLTIP: Blends two colours together with a given ratio (0.0 - 1.0).
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_WHILE: While a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_UNTIL: While a value is false, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FOR_TOOLTIP: Have the given variable take on the values from the start number to the end number, counting by the specified interval, and do the specified blocks.
CONTROLS_FOREACH_TOOLTIP: For each item in a list, set the variable '%1' to the item, and then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_OPERATOR_CONTIN: continue with next iteration of loop
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_BREAK: Break out of the containing loop.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_CONTINU: Skip the rest of this loop, and continue with the next iteration.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_WARNING: Warning: This block may only be used within a loop.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_1: If a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_2: If a value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_3: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_4: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements. If none of the values are true, do the last block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_IF_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSEIF_TOOLTIP: Add a condition to the if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSE_TOOLTIP: Add a final, catch-all condition to the if block.
IOS_VARIABLES_EMPTY_NAME_ERROR: You can't use an empty variable name.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_EQ: Returns true if both inputs equal each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_NEQ: Returns true if both inputs are not equal to each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LT: Returns true if the first input is smaller than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LTE: Returns true if the first input is smaller than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GT: Returns true if the first input is greater than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GTE: Returns true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_AND: Returns true if both inputs are true.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_OR: Returns true if at least one of the inputs is true.
LOGIC_NEGATE_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the input is false. Returns false if the input is true.
LOGIC_TERNARY_TOOLTIP: Check the condition in 'test'. If the condition is true, returns the 'if true' value; otherwise returns the 'if false' value.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_ADD: Return the sum of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MINUS: Return the difference of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MULTIPLY: Return the product of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_DIVIDE: Return the quotient of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_POWER: Return the first number raised to the power of the second number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ROOT: Return the square root of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ABS: Return the absolute value of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_NEG: Return the negation of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LN: Return the natural logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LOG10: Return the base 10 logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_EXP: Return e to the power of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_POW10: Return 10 to the power of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_SIN: Return the sine of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_COS: Return the cosine of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_TAN: Return the tangent of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ASIN: Return the arcsine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ACOS: Return the arccosine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ATAN: Return the arctangent of a number.
MATH_CONSTANT_TOOLTIP: Return one of the common constants: π (3.141…), e (2.718…), φ (1.618…), sqrt(2) (1.414…), sqrt(½) (0.707…), or ∞ (infinity).
MATH_IS_TOOLTIP: Check if a number is an even, odd, prime, whole, positive, negative, or if it is divisible by certain number. Returns true or false.
MATH_ROUND_TOOLTIP: Round a number up or down.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_SUM: Return the sum of all the numbers in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MIN: Return the smallest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MAX: Return the largest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_AVERAGE: Return the average (arithmetic mean) of the numeric values in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MEDIAN: Return the median number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MODE: Return a list of the most common item(s) in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_STD_DEV: Return the standard deviation of the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_RANDOM: Return a random element from the list.
MATH_MODULO_TOOLTIP: Return the remainder from dividing the two numbers.
MATH_CONSTRAIN_TOOLTIP: Constrain a number to be between the specified limits (inclusive).
MATH_RANDOM_INT_TOOLTIP: Return a random integer between the two specified limits, inclusive.
MATH_RANDOM_FLOAT_TOOLTIP: Return a random fraction between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
TEXT_TEXT_TOOLTIP: A letter, word, or line of text.
TEXT_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Create a piece of text by joining together any number of items.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this text block.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the text.
TEXT_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of letters (including spaces) in the provided text.
TEXT_ISEMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the provided text is empty.
TEXT_INDEXOF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of the first text in the second text. Returns %1 if text is not found.
TEXT_CHARAT_TOOLTIP: Returns the letter at the specified position.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_TOOLTIP: Returns a specified portion of the text.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_START_FROM_END: get substring from letter # from end
TEXT_CHANGECASE_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text in a different case.
TEXT_TRIM_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text with spaces removed from one or both ends.
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_BOTH: trim spaces from both sides of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_LEFT: trim spaces from left side of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_RIGHT: trim spaces from right side of
TEXT_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Print the specified text, number or other value.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_NUMBER: Prompt for user for a number.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_TEXT: Prompt for user for some text.
TEXT_COUNT_TOOLTIP: Count how many times some text occurs within some other text.
TEXT_REPLACE_TOOLTIP: Replace all occurances of some text within some other text.
TEXT_REVERSE_TOOLTIP: Reverses the order of the characters in the text.
LISTS_CREATE_EMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns a list, of length 0, containing no data records
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_TOOLTIP: Create a list with any number of items.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_CONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this list block.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the list.
LISTS_REPEAT_TOOLTIP: Creates a list consisting of the given value repeated the specified number of times.
LISTS_REPEAT_TITLE: create list with item %1 repeated %2 times
LISTS_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the length of a list.
LISTS_ISEMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the list is empty.
LISTS_INDEX_OF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of the item in the list. Returns %1 if item is not found.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM: Returns the item at the specified position in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FIRST: Returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_LAST: Returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_RANDOM: Returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FROM: Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes and returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_LAST: Removes and returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_RANDO: Removes and returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM: Removes the item at the specified position in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_LAST: Removes the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_RANDOM: Removes a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM: Sets the item at the specified position in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FIRST: Sets the first item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_LAST: Sets the last item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_RANDOM: Sets a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FIRST: Inserts the item at the start of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_LAST: Append the item to the end of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_RANDOM: Inserts the item randomly in a list.
LISTS_GET_SUBLIST_TOOLTIP: Creates a copy of the specified portion of a list.
LISTS_SORT_TOOLTIP: Sort a copy of a list.
LISTS_SPLIT_TOOLTIP_SPLIT: Split text into a list of texts, breaking at each delimiter.
LISTS_SPLIT_TOOLTIP_JOIN: Join a list of texts into one text, separated by a delimiter.
LISTS_REVERSE_TOOLTIP: Reverse a copy of a list.
VARIABLES_GET_TOOLTIP: Returns the value of this variable.
VARIABLES_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets this variable to be equal to the input.
PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with no output.
PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with an output.
PROCEDURES_DEF_DUPLICATE_WARNING: Warning: This function has duplicate parameters.
PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_TOOLTIP: Run the user-defined function '%1' and use its output.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORCONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder inputs to this function.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORARG_TOOLTIP: Add an input to the function.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_TOOLTIP: If a value is true, then return a second value.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_WARNING: Warning: This block may be used only within a function definition.
ARD_ANALOGWRITE_TIP: Writes analog value between 0 and 255 to a specific PWM Port
ARD_HIGHLOW_TIP: Sets a pin state logic High or Low.
ARD_DIGITALREAD_TIP: Reads digital value on a pin: HIGH or LOW
ARD_DIGITALWRITE_TIP: Writes digital value HIGH or LOW to a specific Port
ARD_BUILTIN_LED_TIP: Lights on or off for the built-in LED of the Arduino
ARD_TONE_PIN_TIP: Generates audio tones on a pin
ARD_NOTONE_PIN_TIP: Stops generating a tone on a pin
ARD_MAP_TIP: Re-maps a number from [0-1024] to another.
ARD_FUN_RUN_TIP: Defines the Oxocard setup() and loop() functions.
ARD_PIN_WARN1: Pin %1 is needed for %2 as pin %3. Already used as %4.
ARD_SERIAL_SETUP_TIP: Selects the speed for a specific Serial peripheral
ARD_SERIAL_PRINT_TIP: Prints data to the console/serial port as human-readable ASCII text.
ARD_SERIAL_PRINT_WARN: A setup block for %1 must be added to the workspace to use this block!
ARD_SERVO_WRITE_TIP: Sets a Servo to an specified angle
ARD_SPI_TRANS_TIP: Sends a SPI message to an specified slave device.
ARD_SPI_TRANS_WARN1: A setup block for %1 must be added to the workspace to use this block!
ARD_SPI_TRANS_WARN2: Old pin value %1 is no longer available.
ARD_SPI_TRANSRETURN_TIP: Send a SPI message to an specified slave device and get data back.
ARD_STEPPER_SETUP_TIP: Configures a stepper motor pinout and other settings.
ARD_STEPPER_STEP_TIP: Turns the stepper motor a specific number of steps.
ARD_COMPONENT_WARN1: A %1 configuration block with the same %2 name must be added to use this block!
ARD_TIME_MILLIS_TIP: Returns the number of milliseconds since the Arduino board began running the current program. Has to be stored in a positive long integer
ARD_TIME_MICROS_TIP: Returns the number of microseconds since the Arduino board began running the current program. Has to be stored in a positive long integer
ARD_VAR_AS_TIP: Sets a value to a specific type
ARD_PULSE_READ_TIMEOUT: measure %1 pulse on pin #%2 (timeout after %3 μs)
ARD_PULSE_TIP: Measures the duration of a pulse on the selected pin.
ARD_PULSETIMEOUT_TIP: Measures the duration of a pulse on the selected pin, if it is within the time-out in microseconds.
ARD_TONE_TIP: Sets tone on pin to specified frequency within range 31 - 65535
ARD_NOTONE_TIP: Turns the tone off on the selected pin
OXOCARD_MATH_INCREMENT_TIP: Does increment the variable with the value 1
OXOCARD_MATH_DECREMENT_TIP: Does decrement the variable with the value -1
OXOCARD_MATH_SET_VAR_WITH_TIP: Sets a variable with an expression (e.g. 1*(5/8))
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_RGB_IMAGE_TIP: Turns on specific pixels with color
OXOCARD_MATRIX_SET_COLOR_TIP: The following draw-blocks will draw this color
OXOCARD_MATRIX_SET_RANDOM_COLOR_TIP: The following draw-blocks will draw a random color.
OXOCARD_MATRIX_SET_COLOR_VAR_TIP: The following draw-blocks will draw this color
OXOCARD_MATRIX_CLEAR_TIP: Clears all pixels on the matrix
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_PIXEL_TIP: Draws the pixel on the defined coordinates
OXOCARD_MATRIX_CLEAR_PIXEL_TIP: Clears the pixel on the defined coordinates
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_LINE_TIP: Draws a line based on the coordinates defined
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_RECTANGLE_TIP: Draws a rectangle based on given positions
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_CIRCLE_TIP: Draws a circle based on given position and radius
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_TRIANGLE_TIP: Draws a triangle based on given positions
OXOCARD_MATRIX_SET_FILL_TIP: Geometric objects are filled when drawn
OXOCARD_MATRIX_SET_NOFILL_TIP: Geometric objects are not filled when drawn
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_NUMBER_TIP: Draws a number on the display
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DRAW_TEXT_TIP: Draws a given text on the display
OXOCARD_MATRIX_SET_FRAME_BUFFER_TIP: Sets the frame buffer which should be used at the moment
OXOCARD_MATRIX_COPY_FRAME_BUFFER_CONTENT: Copies the content of the given source frame buffer to the other
OXOCARD_MATRIX_ENABLE_AUTO_UPDATE_TIP: Enalbes that all draw functions will be drawn immediately on the display
OXOCARD_MATRIX_DISABLE_AUTO_UPDATE_TIP: Disalbes that all draw functions will be drawn immediately on the display
OXOCARD_MATRIX_READ_PIXEL_TIP: Returns the color (RGB) of the given pixel
OXOCARD_MATRIX_IS_PIXEL_TIP: Returns true if at least one color (RGB) of the pixel is set
OXOCARD_TURN_OXOCARD_OFF_TIP2: Turns off the card and set the buttons able to wake the card up
OXOCARD_AUTO_TURNOFF_TIP: Enters sleep mode after given timeout
OXOCARD_READ_BATTERY_VOLTAGE_TIP: Reads the battery voltage in millivolt
OXOCARD_IS_BATTERY_FULLY_CHARGED_TIP: Returns true if battery is fully charged
OXOCARD_IS_USB_PLUGGED_IN_TIP: Returns true if USB cable is plugged in
OXOCARD_BUTTON_PRESSED_TIP: Checks if the button is pressed; Returns true or false
OXOCARD_GET_TIMER_SECONDS_TIP: Returns the seconds value uf the timer
OXOCARD_PRINT_TIP: Prints the given number or string to the console
OXOCARD_PRINTLN_TIP: Prints the given number or string to the console (with new line)
OXOCARD_UPDATE_TIP: Updates the Oxocard with the newest code from Blokly
OXOCARD_GET_ACCELERATION_TIP: Returns the selected accelerometer axis value
OXOCARD_GET_ORIENTATION_TIP: Returns the orientation of the Oxocard
OXOCARD_IS_ORIENTATION_TIP: Returns if the Oxocard is in the given orientation
OXOCARD_SET_CURSOR_TIP: Sets the position of the cursor
OXOCARD_GET_CURSOR_VALUE_TIP: Gets the x- or y-value of the cursor
OXOCARD_SETUP_AS_IBEACON_TIP: Sets the Oxocard up as iBeacon with the given ID
OXOCARD_FIND_IBEACON_TIP: Search for iBeacons with the given ID
OXOCARD_TONE_TIP: Plays a tone for the givern time
OXOCARD_WEATHER_GET_FROM_TIP: Gets the weatherdata from the selected city
OXOCARD_WEATHER_GET_VALUE_TIP: Reads a value from the weatherdata
OXOCARD_WEATHER_GET_AND_DRAW_CITY_TIP: Draws the name of the city from the weatherdata
OXOCARD_COMM_ENABLE_TIP: Enables the sending and receiving of messages
OXOCARD_COMM_DISABLE_TIP: Disables the sending and receiving of messages
OXOCARD_COMM_WAIT_FOR_MESSAGE_TIP: Waits until a new message is received
OXOCARD_COMM_WAIT_FOR_MESSAGE_TIMEOUT_TI: Waits for a given time for a message
OXOCARD_COMM_SEND_DIRECT_MESSAGE_TIP: Sends a message to the specified Oxocard
OXOCARD_COMM_SEND_DIRECT_NUMBER_TIP: Sends a number to the specified Oxocard
OXOCARD_COMM_CHECK_FOR_DIRECT_TIP: Checks if a new direct message was received
OXOCARD_COMM_COMPARE_DIRECT_MESSAGE_TIP: Compares the direct message with the given message
OXOCARD_COMM_COMPARE_DIRECT_NUMBER_TIP: Compares the direct number with the given number
OXOCARD_COMM_GET_AND_DRAW_DIRECT_MESSAGE: Draws the text from the received direct message
OXOCARD_COMM_GET_DIRECT_NUMBER_TIP: Reads the number from the received direct message
OXOCARD_COMM_SEND_BROADCAST_MESSAGE_TIP: Sends a broadcast message with the given text
OXOCARD_COMM_SEND_BROADCAST_NUMBER_TIP: Broadcasts a number to every Oxocard
OXOCARD_COMM_CHECK_FOR_BROADCAST_TIP: Checks if the received message is new and permitted
OXOCARD_COMM_COMPARE_BROADCAST_MESSAGE_T: Compares the received broadcast message with the given message
OXOCARD_COMM_COMPARE_BROADCAST_NUMBER_TI: Compares the received broadcast number with the given number
OXOCARD_COMM_GET_AND_DRAW_BROADCAST_MESS: Draws the text or the sender of the received message
OXOCARD_COMM_GET_BROADCAST_NUMBER_TIP: Reads the value of the defined variable of the received message
OXOCARD_COMM_SET_SENDER_WHITELIST_TIP: Sets the sender filter with one or more names (e.g. "Oxocard20, Tim, James"). To reset the list, leave the input field empty or write a *
OXOCARD_COMM_SET_RECEIVER_LIST_TIP: Sets the receiver list with one or more names (e.g. "Oxocard20, Tim, James"). To reset the list, leave the input field empty or write a *
OXOCARD_COMM_SET_USER_MESSAGE_TIP: Sets the text message to be sent
OXOCARD_COMM_SET_USER_VALUE_TIP: Sets the value of a variable to be sent
OXOCARD_COMM_SEND_MESSAGE_TIP: Sends a message with previously defined text and variables
OXOCARD_COMM_SEND_MESSAGE_TO_TIP: Sends a message with previously defined text and variables to one or more receivers (e.g. "Oxocard20, Tim, James" or a "*" to locally send to all participants)
OXOCARD_COMM_CHECK_SENDER_TIP: Checks if received message is from the given sender
OXOCARD_COMM_IS_MESSAGE_FOR_ME_TIP: Checks if received message is for me
OXOCARD_COMM_COMPARE_MESSAGE_TIP: Compares the received message with the given message
OXOCARD_COMM_SET_COMMUNICATION_TYPE_TIP: Sets the communication type to either local (within the same network) or internet (globally)
OXOCARD_AUDIO_WAIT_NOT_FOR_TONE_TIP: Does not wait after every following tone
OXOCARD_AUDIO_SET_VOLUME_TIP: Sets the voume of the audio output
OXOCARD_AUDIO_GET_VOLUME_TIP: Gets the volume from the audio output
OXOCARD_AUDIO_VOLUME_UP_TIP: Turns the volume one step up
OXOCARD_AUDIO_VOLUME_DOWN_TIP: Turns the volume one step down
OXOCARD_AUDIO_SET_OCTAVE_TIP: Sets the global octave for the tones
OXOCARD_AUDIO_SET_WAVEFORM_TIP: Sets the global waveform for the tones
OXOCARD_AUDIO_SET_BPM_TIP: Sets the global beats per minute (BPM)
OXOCARD_AUDIO_WAIT_TIP: Waits for a given tone duration
OXOCARD_AUDIO_PLAY_TONE_TIP: Plays a tone. the octave can set with the corresponding block
OXOCARD_AUDIO_RECORD_FOR_TIP: Records audio data for given time in milliseconds
OXOCARD_AUDIO_WAIT_FOR_LOUD_NOISE_TIP: Waits until a loud noise is measured by the microphone
OXOCARD_AUDIO_PLAY_SOUND_EFFECT_TIP: Plays a selected sound effect once or forever
OXOCARD_TIME_GET_MILLIS_TIP: Returns the past milliseconds since the program start
OXOCARD_TIME_UPDATE_TIP: Updates the time on the Oxocard
OXOCARD_TIME_GET_FROM_TIP: Gets the time of a given city
OXOCARD_TIME_GET_VALUE_TIP: Gets a specific value from the time (e.g. seconds)
OXOCARD_LIST_ADD_TIP: Append given value to the list
OXOCARD_LIST_ADD_COLOR_TIP: Append given value to the color list
OXOCARD_LIST_GET_TIP: Get defined element from the list
OXOCARD_LIST_GET_COLOR_TIP: Get defined element from the color list
OXOCARD_LIST_REMOVE_TIP: Remove defined element from the list
OXOCARD_LIST_REMOVE_COLOR_TIP: Remove defined element from the color list
OXOCARD_RANDOM_TIP: Returns a random number between (and with) the first given value to (and with) the second value
OXOCARD_CONNECT_TO_INTERNET_TIP: Opens a connection to the internet
